description:
Job Title & Specialty Area: Sr Data Scientist

Department: Heart Center Admin

Location: Dallas

Shift: Monday - Friday 8am -4:30pm

Job Type: Remote

Why Children’s Health?
At Children's Health, our mission is to Make Life Better for Children, and we recognize that their health plays a crucial role in achieving this goal. Through our cutting-edge treatments and affiliation with UT Southwestern, we strive to deliver an extraordinary patient and family experience, ensuring that every moment, big or small, contributes to their overall well-being. Our dedication to promoting children's health extends beyond our organization and encompasses the broader community. Together, we can make a significant difference in the lives of children and contribute to a brighter and healthier future for all.

Summary:
The Data Science team develops and deploys analytic solutions to equip stakeholders with data-based insights empowering them to effectively measure performance, establish improvement goals, comprehend relationships between variables, predict outcomes and make strategic decisions. The Sr. Data Scientist will be involved in all steps of the process including data gathering, cleaning, validation, analysis, modeling, visualization, and presentation for manuscripts and posters utilizing R or SAS to create tables and figures - and will often be responsible for directing the technical work of others on the team as well as in other functions in the department or division. The Sr. Data Scientist will be responsible for the translation of statistical findings for researchers utilizing tables, figures, etc. The Sr. Data Scientist acts as the primary expert for two or more technically advanced solutions as described in the responsibilities section below.

Responsibilities:
• Design workflow for and guide information systems experts to identify data sources, gather and validate necessary data. Work closely with senior operational and/or clinical experts to ensure that complex data content is complete, accurate and relevant. Intermediate knowledge related to database management is required. Intermediate proficiency in SQL or other data gathering technology and familiarity with Big Data concepts is strongly preferred. Working knowledge and experience with Microsoft Visual Studio and SQL Server Management Studio. Additional working knowledge in configuration and production environments of cloud computing platforms such as Azure and AWS.
• Guide others and/or perform complex statistical analyses of data sets to identify performance status, trends over time and key drivers. Translate findings for researchers and creation of tables and figures for manuscripts and posters using R or SAS. Advanced knowledge of descriptive and inferential statistics with demonstrated proficiency in sampling theory, forecasting, regression, non-normal distributions and hypothesis testing is required. Advanced proficiency in a statistical software package (Minitab, JMP, Stata, QI Macros, Alteryx, SAS Enterprise Miner, Python, R, etc.) is required.
• Create, present and publish elegant graphical representations of analyses and key findings and their impact to strategic business indicators to a wide variety of stakeholders. Advanced proficiency in PowerPoint and a data visualization software package (MicroStrategy, Power BI, SAS VA or Tableau) is required White paper or research paper publication experience strongly preferred. Public speaking experience required. Knowledge of basic color theory is preferred.
• Participate in or lead quality/process improvement initiatives research initiatives and other strategic programs as the voice of the data ensuring that data limitations, interpretation and insights are accurately comprehended by stakeholders and decision makers. Topics may include clinical, operational and/or financial domains. Familiarity with Lean Six Sigma and healthcare operations is strongly preferred. Financial acumen including ability to read and interpret financial statements is preferred.
• Act as the team's resident expert in two or more technically advanced analytic solutions such as GIS data mapping, complex visualization, process simulation, predictive modeling, machine learning, natural language processing, program evaluation and other specialties. Intermediate proficiency in programming languages such as R or Python (or similar) is required.
• Guide the activities of junior team members. Mentor other peers in area of specialty to support their development. Teach statistical concepts and methods to various stakeholders as needed. Formal peer training experience required.

How You’ll Be Successful:

WORK EXPERIENCE
• At least 10 years in data wrangling, analysis, visualization and advanced techniques. Req

EDUCATION
• Four-year bachelor's degree or equivalent experience Computer Science, Engineering (all types), Mathematics, Statistics, and Economics. Candidates with other STEM degrees such as core sciences (Physics, Chemistry, etc.) could be considered Req
• Graduate or professional work or advanced degree; or equivalent experience PhD Preferred Req

LICENSES AND CERTIFICATIONS
• Udacity Nanodegree: Machine Learning and/or Artificial Intelligence (or equivalent) Pref
• Lean Six Sigma Black Belt Pref
• SAS Enterprise Guide, Enterprise Miner, Visual Analytics, Developer, Predictive Modeling Pref

A Place Where You Belong

We put our people first. We welcome, value, and respect the beliefs, identities and experiences of our patients and colleagues. We are committed to delivering culturally effective care, creating meaningful partnerships in the communities we serve, and equipping and developing our team members to make Children’s Health a place where everyone can contribute.

Holistic Benefits – How We’ll Care for You:

· Employee portion of medical plan premiums are covered after 3 years.

· 4%-10% employee savings plan match based on tenure

· Paid Parental Leave (up to 12 weeks)

· Caregiver Leave

· Adoption and surrogacy reimbursement >
